column3: 6 eggs10 strips bacon (pre cooked)2 slices white American cheeseoregano (optional)milk
column5: Crack eggs into mixing bowl. Add milk and oregano. Beat well. Cut bacon into small pieces and heat - be careful not to overcook. Cut cheese into small pieces. When bacon is heated, pour eggs into pan. Immediately add cheese. Stir and flip until eggs are done as you like it.
column8: This is a test of the recipe entry system.

column3: 2 tbsp olive oil2 tbsp all-purpose flour2 medium onioonns, chopped (about 2c )2 celery ribs, chopped (about 1c )1/2 medium red bell pepper, cored, seeded & chopped3 garlic cloves, minced1-1/2 c tomato or V8 juice3 c cooked red beans, drained (canned OK )1/2 tsp cayenne pepper (or less )Salt and pepper, to taste3 c hot cooked brown or white riceAdditional Tabasco or other hot pepper sauce
column5: Heat the oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat; stir in flour and cook stirring constantly, until mixture turns a caramel color, about 5 minutes. Stir in the onions, celery, bell pepper and garlic. Cook stirring constantly, until vegetables are lightly browned.Stir tomato juice, beans,  cayenne, and black pepper into vegetable mixture. Cook stirring occasionally, until the beans are warmed through, about 8 to 10 minutes. Mash some of the beands against the side of the pan, if desired, and stir until the mixture thickens. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve over hot rice. Pass additional Tabasco.

column3: 6 slices bread1/4 to 1/2c water2 lb ground beef or turkey3 eggs1/2c grated Parmesan cheese3 cloves garlic, crushed3 tbsp parsley salt & pepper to taste
column5: In large bowl, soak bread in water. Do not squeeze out excess water. Stir in ground beef, eggs, Parmesan cheese, garlic, parsley,salt & pepper to taste. Mix well. If mixture seems dry, add water, a few teaspoons at a time. Form into 1-1/2 inch meatballs. In large skillet, heat oil & brown meatballs evenly, a few at a time. Can be browned in oven broiler, if desired or added, raw, to a jar of spaghetti sauce and simmered til cooked.
column8: You can also cut recipe in half and use 1 lb of meat

column3: 3 tbsp olive oil1 med. onion, chopped2 cloves garlic, halved2 (29 oz) cans tomato sauce1 (28 oz) can plum tomatoes,chopped2 (12 oz) cans tomato paste2c water3 tbsp parsley2 tbsp granulated sugar1 tbsp oregano1 tsp basilsalt & pepper to taste
column5: In large pot, heat oil. Stir in onion & gaarlic. Cook 1 to 2 minutes until onion is tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat & simmer sauce for about 2-1/2 hours ( adding meatballs after 1-1/2 hrs).

column3: Adrienne's Lasagne Sauce2 lb ricotta cheese2 eggs3 tbsp parlsey1 to 1-1/4 lb fresh lasagne noodles OR  12 dry lasagne noodles1-1/2 lb thinly sliced mozzarella cheese1 to 1-1/4c grated Parmesan cheeseAdditional Parmesan
column5: In large bowl, thorougly beat together ricotta cheese, eggs & parsley. Set aside. Use 3 cups of sauce to assemble lasagne. In 13 X 9 inch pan, spread 1/2c of sauce to cover the bottom. Add a sheet of uncooked, fresh noodles or 3 slightly cooked dry noodles, spread 1/4 of ricotta mixture over noodles, place 1/4 mozzarella, spread 1/2c sauce  & sprinkle 1/4 of Parmesan.  Repeat procedure (noodles, ricotta, mozzarella, sauce, Parmesan) 3 more times & end with noodles. Spoon 1/2c sauce on top. Sprinkle with Parmesan.Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes until mixture is bubbly and golden. Serve with meatballs & remaining sauce on side.
